diff_hunk:
@@ -695,13 +695,13 @@
   self: hardshrink_backward(grad, self, lambd)
 
 - name: hardtanh(Tensor self, Scalar min_val, Scalar max_val)
-  self: hardtanh_backward(grad, self, min_val, max_val)
+  self: hardtanh_backward(grad, output, min_val, max_val)
 
 - name: hardtanh_(Tensor self, Scalar min_val, Scalar max_val)
   self: hardtanh_backward(grad, output, min_val, max_val)
 
 - name: leaky_relu(Tensor self, Scalar negative_slope)
-  self: leaky_relu_backward(grad, self, negative_slope)
+  self: leaky_relu_backward(grad, output, negative_slope)
body: Does this only expand to calling `at::leaky_relu_backward(grad, output, negative_slope)`, or do we still have some more complicated rules for NN? It's weird that swapping input for output is still handled correctly O_o
body_html: Does this only expand to calling at::leaky_relu_backward(grad, output, negative_slope), or do we still have some more complicated rules for NN? It's weird that swapping input for output is still handled correctly O_o
